So you’ve decided to step into the DANGER ZONE?! You’re so brave. Now that you’ve set your name, it’s time to understand the DANGER. You can walk at any time by selecting the WALK option on the main screen. Choose how long you’d like to walk, and we’ll load a DANGER ZONE SCENARIO for you to escape from — or try! 
 
DANGER ZONE can also prompt you with a sudden DANGER ZONE SCENARIO throughout the day! To enable this option, select the GEAR on the main page, where you can say yes to the test. 
 
Once running, you’ll have the displayed amount of time to ESCAPE FROM THE DANGER ZONE! The twists and turns you take will vary with each scenario so keep up the pace or end up on your face. Track your steps and progress, earn titles and achievements, compete against your friends, AND MORE! All while avoiding spending too much time sitting at your couch or desk!
 
Can you escape… the DANGER ZONE?? HOW TO PLAY: OK Acknowledgments Developer Notes
Design Considerations:
 - The number of steps that is required to complete a walk is currently likely on the lower end of things making the game a bit easier for our target audience which is people living a sedentary lifestyle. In the future we might consider adding difficulty levels to make it more interesting as players advance.
 - Considered a battery savery mode for the actual walk activity but instead we decided to let the app continue to run even if the phone had the lock button pressed. This is because this is a way to manage the battery life. Additionally since the game does not require the player to constantly monitor the screen during the walk, it would make more sense that they could walk and have it on in the background. The music was set to stop if the app lost focus since it would be obnoxious if it kept going.
 - We opted for no action bar since this was a hybrid game/fitness app but we wanted to make it seem more "fun" instead of having it just a utility pedometer app. The main menu would be the launch point for all the other activities in the app. The inspiration for this was Hearthstone where you never get more than one back button press away from the main menu. Currently all of our activities are like this except one which is two back button presses away. For real app deployment we would look into making this look more aesthetically pleasing and making this the optimal user experience.
 - We thought about adding a countdown before the beginning of the walk. We opted not to because when people hit the walk button they generally expect the activity to start. From being avid Pokemon Go players, we have noticed that during the countdown before gym battles, most people are already tapping their phones and in general impatient for the event to begin.
 - We decided not to add moving images to the app as we did not want people to be staring at the screen while they were out for a walk and risk getting injured. This app is first and foremost a fitness app that is trying to be more interesting than a pedometer, so it is not a game that you have to constantly look at the screen for. Eventually we would want to add some in-walk bonuses but those would be alerted somehow so the player would not have to constantly look at the screen.
 - We did not implement app wide volume controls as we felt most users manage sound at a global level on their devices for sensitive situations. An example of such a situation would be at the movies or during a meeting. Most people would turn off their phones completely, put them on silent, etc.


Future Improvements:
 The following is a list of improvements that we would want to implement for an app for full release later on.
 - Add more levels as the game is currently capped at level 5. - Add more scenarios in future releases so that they could be randomly selected by the app and would be more interesting for the user.
 - Add more achievements to the game to keep the interest level in the game higher. Things like achievements for walking a certain number of times, doing enough specific scenarios, doing them right when the notification appears, etc.
 - Add location sharing and a two player mode with friends nearby so that walkers can meet up and walk together. Again aiming to keep engagement levels high.
 - Improve the graphic design and sounds to look more polished and interesting.
